etymologies: mid 17th century: from Greek anarkhos ‘without a chief’ (see anarchy) + -ism; later influenced by French anarchisme

definitions: a political theory advocating the abolition of hierarchical government and the organization of society on a voluntary, cooperative basis without recourse to force or compulsion.
shortDefinitions: political theory advocating organization of society on cooperative basis

definitions: anarchists as a political force or movement

examples.text: ruling-class fears of international anarchism during the 1890s

shortDefinitions: political force or movement based on belief in anarchism
